DIT FRANZ (literally: Franz said) in French French would be DIT PAR FRANZ. However, in informal French, people often shorten "dit" to "dit pas" (didn't say), so it could be DIJE PAS FRANZ as well. In formal written French, it's best to stick with DIT PAR FRANZ.

DIT FRANZ (literally: Franz said) in French French would be DIT PAR FRANZ. However, in informal French, people often shorten "dit" to "dit pas" (didn't say), so it could be DIJE PAS FRANZ as well. In formal written French, it's best to stick with DIT PAR FRANZ.

SUSURRÉ VALENTINE (William Shakespeare)

Cette phrase est issues des Chroniques d'Henri VI de William Shakespeare. L'expression "Murmured Valentine" est employée par Talbot pour désigner sa femme qui flût ensemble dans la nuit pour enfreindre les ordres de Richarde Plantagenêt de ne rien dire à ce sujet.
